document.docAuthor: Nurinsiyah, Ayu Savitri, Neiber, Marco T. & Hausdorf, Bernhard
document.docTitle: Landouria nodifera Nurinsiyah & Neiber & Hausdorf 2019, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Revision of the land snail genus Landouria Godwin-Austen, 1918 (Gastropoda, Camaenidae) from Java

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of the land snail genus Landouria Godwin-Austen, 1918 (Gastropoda, Camaenidae) from Java

subSubSection.paragraph:
Landouria nodifera
sp. nov. is characterized by a strongly depressed conical, brownish-corneous, sharply keeled shell and a penis that becomes broader towards is proximal end, the presence of a coecum at the proximal end of the penis and a node at the base of the flagellum.

Landouria nodifera
sp. nov. is named after the node at its flagellum (Latin: ʻnodusʼ = ʻnodeʼ, ʻferreʼ = ʻto carryʼ; used as an adjective).

materialsCitation.collectorName: A. S. Nurinsiyah & F. L. H. Irsyad & F. J. Sari & E. Nurlaela

subSubSection.paragraph:
INDONESIA –
Central Java
• 1 spec. ; same data as for holotype;
MZB 19233
•
6 spec. ; same data as for holotype;
MZB 19228
•
5 spec. ; same data as for holotype; ZMH 133428
•
9 spec. (det. anat.); Pati , Larangan Village , Lowo Cave ; 6°54′19″ S , 111°03′24″ E ;
112 m a.s.l.
;
MZB 19229
•
1 spec. ; same data as for preceding;
MZB 21266
.

GENITALIA ( Figs 40 , 64 ; Table 4 ). Atrium short; penis long, consisting of a cylindrical distal part covered by an additional sheath, connected by muscular tissue to proximal part of epiphallus, and a dilated proximal part containing a short penial papilla; inside proximal part of penis with longitudinal pilasters, which pass into a more complex sculpture in distal part of penis; at proximal end of penis with a blunt penis coecum; penial retractor runs from diaphragm to distal part of epiphallus, which tapers proximally; flagellum moderately long, broadest in its middle part, where it is equipped with a node, tapering towards its proximal end; vas deferens narrow and long; vagina long; peduncle of bursa copulatrix subdivided into a broader, cylindrical distal part and a narrower, longer proximal part, ending in an elongate oval bursa beside albumen gland. Right ommatophoral retractor runs between penis and vagina.

Landouria nodifera
sp. nov. ,
L. tonywhitteni
sp. nov. ,
L. pacitanensis
sp. nov. ,
L. sukoliloensis
sp. nov. ,
L. sewuensis
sp. nov. and
L. intumescens
share strongly depressed, brownish-corneous, sharply keeled shells. These species cannot be reliably distinguished by shell characters.
Landouria nodifera
sp. nov. shares having a coecum at the proximal end of the penis with
L. pacitanensis
sp. nov. , from which it differs in the lack of the narrow constriction subdividing the penis of
L. pacitanensis
sp. nov. and the presence of a node at the base of the flagellum.
Landouria nodifera
sp. nov. shares having a node at the base of the flagellum with
L. tonywhitteni
sp. nov. , from which it differs in the presence of the coecum at the proximal end of the penis and the proximally broader penis.

Landouria nodifera
sp. nov. is endemic to Sukolilo Karst (Fig. 54).
